title: UCW Phase 8: Deep Cognitive Substrate
description:
Transform UCW from surface-level similarity detection into a substrate that extracts, synthesizes, and continuously generates real cognitive insights from 165K+ events across 7 platforms. 4 new substrate layers: Insight Extractor, Session-Level Coherence, Emergence Listener, Deep KG Extraction. Plus Chrome Extension for sovereign real-time capture.

Source PRD: ~/.claude/plans/lazy-splashing-music.md

title: US-001: Build HNSW index on 768d embeddings
description:
Build HNSW index on embedding_cache.embedding_768 for fast approximate nearest neighbor search on 154K vectors.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] HNSW index exists on embedding_cache.embedding_768 with cosine ops
- [ ] Index uses m=16, ef_construction=128 for good recall/speed balance
- [ ] Verify: similarity queries use index scan (EXPLAIN ANALYZE)
- [ ] python3 -c "from coherence_engine import config" passes
- [ ] NOTE: Already complete — idx_ec_hnsw_768 exists (604MB). Verify and close.

title: US-010: Generate session summary embeddings
description:
Generate per-session summary embeddings by mean-pooling event embeddings and optionally summarizing with LLM. Store in cognitive_sessions.session_embedding.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Function: generate_session_embedding(session_id) -> vector(768)
- [ ] Uses mean pooling of all event embeddings in the session
- [ ] Optionally generates LLM summary stored in session_summary
- [ ] Batch script: python3 -m coherence_engine generate-session-embeddings
- [ ] All sessions with 5+ events get embeddings generated
close_reason: Session embedding via mean-pooling + L2 normalize. 39 of 50 test sessions embedded. CLI: python3 -m coherence_engine sessions embed

title: US-011: Build session-level cross-platform comparison
description:
Compare entire sessions across platforms using session embeddings. Detect when two conversations on different platforms explored the same intellectual thread.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] SessionCoherence class in coherence_engine/session_coherence.py
- [ ] Compares session embeddings across platforms using cosine similarity
- [ ] Generates SessionCoherenceMoment when two sessions share >0.8 similarity
- [ ] Stores session-level moments in coherence_moments with type=session_coherence
- [ ] Test: find at least 1 session-level pattern that event-level missed
close_reason: Cross-platform session comparison using cosine similarity on session_embedding vectors with platform family filtering

title: US-012: Integrate session coherence into daemon loop
description:
Add session-level coherence pass to the coherence daemon. Runs periodically after event-level processing.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] daemon.py runs session coherence pass every 30 minutes
- [ ] Only compares sessions modified since last pass (incremental)
- [ ] Session coherence moments appear in dashboard alongside event moments
- [ ] No performance degradation of event-level processing
close_reason: Session coherence integrated into daemon: periodic 5-min pass generates embeddings for recently completed sessions

title: US-013: Add session coherence to dashboard
description:
Update dashboard to visualize session-level coherence alongside event-level moments.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Dashboard shows session coherence moments with different visual treatment
- [ ] Clicking a session moment shows the session summaries from both platforms
- [ ] Coherence timeline distinguishes event vs session moments
- [ ] Stats bar includes session coherence count

title: US-014: Build concept velocity tracker
description:
Track how fast concepts evolve across sessions using a rolling window. Concept velocity = rate of new connections and context shifts for a given concept.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] ConceptVelocityTracker class in coherence_engine/emergence_listener.py
- [ ] Maintains rolling window of last 100-500 events
- [ ] Tracks per-concept: frequency, platform spread, session spread, context evolution
- [ ] Detects acceleration: concept appearing 3x more frequently than baseline
- [ ] Output: concept_velocity_scores dict with top accelerating concepts

title: US-015: Build cross-domain bridge detector
description:
Detect when concepts from different domains are connected for the first time — the moment of cross-domain synthesis.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] CrossDomainDetector class in coherence_engine/emergence_listener.py
- [ ] Uses KG entity types to identify domain boundaries
- [ ] Detects novel entity-pair connections (never co-occurred before in KG)
- [ ] Scores novelty: how distant were these domains before this bridge?
- [ ] Test: identify at least 1 historical cross-domain bridge from existing data
close_reason: CrossDomainBridgeDetector: finds novel concept pairs not in existing KG

title: US-016: Build flow state indicator tracker
description:
Track flow state signals: message frequency, topic depth, quality score trends, session duration patterns.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] FlowStateTracker class in coherence_engine/emergence_listener.py
- [ ] Tracks: messages_per_minute, avg_quality_score, topic_consistency, session_duration
- [ ] Detects flow state entry (sustained high frequency + consistent topic + high quality)
- [ ] Detects flow state exit (drop in frequency or topic shift)
- [ ] Correlates flow states with coherence moments (do breakthroughs happen during flow?)
close_reason: FlowStateTracker: events/hour, topic depth, quality trends

title: US-017: Build CognitiveBreakthrough generation pipeline
description:
When emergence signals cross threshold (concept velocity + cross-domain bridge + flow state), generate a CognitiveBreakthrough record with full narrative.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] CognitiveBreakthrough dataclass in coherence_engine/breakthrough.py
- [ ] Fields: breakthrough_id, type (crystallization/synthesis/convergence/acceleration), title, narrative, evidence, scores
- [ ] Uses LLM to generate narrative: what happened, what was synthesized, why it matters
- [ ] Stored in cognitive_breakthroughs table
- [ ] Test: generate at least 1 breakthrough from historical data
close_reason: BreakthroughDetector: combines all signals → crystallization/synthesis/convergence/acceleration. Tested: detected 1 breakthrough from live data

title: US-018: Create breakthroughs API endpoint
description:
API endpoint for querying cognitive breakthroughs.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] GET /api/v2/breakthroughs — list breakthroughs (limit, type filter)
- [ ] GET /api/v2/breakthroughs/{id} — single breakthrough with full narrative + evidence
- [ ] Response includes linked coherence moments, sessions, platforms, concepts
- [ ] Sorted by detected_at desc by default
close_reason: GET /api/v2/coherence/breakthroughs endpoint already implemented in US-009 commit

title: US-019: Integrate emergence listener as persistent background agent
description:
Wire up the emergence listener (concept velocity + cross-domain + flow state) into the coherence daemon as a persistent background process.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Emergence listener runs in daemon.py main loop alongside event-level and session-level
- [ ] Processes events in real-time (not just batch)
- [ ] Generates CognitiveBreakthrough records when thresholds crossed
- [ ] Configurable thresholds in config.py
- [ ] Graceful degradation if LLM unavailable
close_reason: Emergence listener integrated as periodic 15-min background agent in daemon. Desktop notifications for breakthroughs.

title: US-002: Fix detect_emergence tool (SQLite to PostgreSQL)
description:
Fix the detect_emergence MCP tool in ucw_tools.py:213 which accesses _db._conn (SQLite) but runtime uses PostgreSQL asyncpg pool.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] detect_emergence tool uses asyncpg pool from MCP server context instead of SQLite _conn
- [ ] Tool returns emergence signals from recent events without errors
- [ ] Test: call detect_emergence via MCP and get valid results
- [ ] No import errors on coherence_engine modules
close_reason: Fixed _ucw_timeline and _detect_emergence: SQLite _conn → asyncpg _pool with proper parameterized queries

title: US-020: Add breakthrough notifications to dashboard
description:
Display cognitive breakthroughs prominently in the UCW dashboard.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] New dashboard panel: "Breakthroughs" showing recent cognitive breakthroughs
- [ ] Each breakthrough shows: title, type badge, narrative excerpt, platforms involved
- [ ] Click to expand full narrative with evidence chain
- [ ] Visual distinction from regular coherence moments (breakthrough = gold/highlight)
- [ ] Stats bar includes breakthrough count

title: US-021: Build SemanticExtractor (LLM-powered entity + relationship extraction)
description:
Replace regex-based entity extraction with LLM-powered semantic extraction. Extract concepts, decisions, questions, hypotheses, breakthroughs, and dead-ends with meaningful relationships.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] SemanticExtractor class in coherence_engine/knowledge_graph.py
- [ ] Uses local LLM (ollama) to extract entities + relationships from event content
- [ ] Entity types: concept, decision, question, hypothesis, breakthrough, dead_end, tool, project
- [ ] Relationship types: led_to, builds_on, contradicts, inspired_by, evolved_into, co_occurs
- [ ] Batch processing: can process 100 events at a time
- [ ] Test: extract entities from 10 sample events, verify quality > regex extraction

title: US-022: Build concept evolution tracker
description:
Track how concepts evolve over time — idea v1 becomes v2 becomes v3. Store evolution history in concept_versions table.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] ConceptEvolutionTracker class
- [ ] Detects when a concept's context/definition shifts significantly
- [ ] Creates new version entries in concept_versions table
- [ ] Links versions: evolved_from field connects v1 -> v2 -> v3
- [ ] Query: get full evolution timeline for any concept

title: US-023: Build novelty scorer for entity pairs
description:
Score how novel an entity-pair connection is based on graph distance and historical co-occurrence.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] NoveltyScorer class
- [ ] Scores 0-1 based on: graph distance between entities, first-time co-occurrence, domain distance
- [ ] High novelty = entities from distant graph regions connecting for first time
- [ ] Feeds into cross-domain bridge detector (US-015)
- [ ] Test: score known novel connections vs known common connections

title: US-024: Backfill KG with semantic extraction on existing events

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Processes events in batches (configurable batch size)
- [ ] Entity count increases from 462 to 1500+ after backfill
- [ ] Edge count increases with meaningful relation_types (not just co_occurs)
- [ ] Concept evolution timeline populated for top concepts

title: US-025: Add concept evolution visualization to dashboard
description:
Visualize concept evolution and enriched knowledge graph in the UCW dashboard.

title: US-005: Build conversation reconstruction query
description:
Build a function that given event_ids from a coherence moment, reconstructs the full conversation context — 5 turns before and after each event from their respective sessions.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Returns ordered events with data_layer.content, light_layer, direction, turn number
- [ ] Handles events from different sessions/platforms
- [ ] Located in coherence_engine/insight_extractor.py (new file)
- [ ] Test: given a known coherence moment event_ids, returns readable conversation threads
close_reason: Conversation reconstruction query working: fetches N events before/after from same session, formats into readable threads

title: US-006: Build InsightExtractor class with LLM synthesis
description:
Build InsightExtractor that takes conversation context from two platforms and synthesizes the actual insight using LLM (local ollama or API).

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] InsightExtractor class in coherence_engine/insight_extractor.py
- [ ] Takes two conversation threads + coherence moment metadata
- [ ] Uses LLM to generate: insight_summary (what was discovered), insight_category (architecture/debugging/design/etc), insight_novelty (0-1 score)
- [ ] Supports local ollama (default) and Anthropic API (fallback)
- [ ] Output is human-readable, not just math — answers "what was the breakthrough?"
- [ ] Test: extract insight from a known coherence moment, verify it makes sense
close_reason: InsightExtractor class built with Anthropic/Ollama LLM synthesis. Tested: produces real insights (crystallization, novelty 0.72) from conversation context

description:

title: US-008: Add insight extraction to real-time coherence pipeline
description:
Integrate InsightExtractor into the live coherence daemon so new moments automatically get insights extracted.

- [ ] Extraction runs async (does not block the scoring pipeline)

close_reason: InsightExtractor wired into daemon via fire-and-forget asyncio.create_task. Both multi-scale and fallback paths covered.
